meta_title: What is Kitting? Meaning, Benefits & Maintenance Strategy
meta_description: Kitting is the process of pre-assembling parts and tools for maintenance tasks. Improve wrench time, reduce inventory shrinkage, and optimize MRO workflows.
title: The Maintenance Leader’s Guide to Kitting: Reducing Wrench Time by 30%

hero_image.alt: Hero image for The Maintenance Leader’s Guide to Kitting: Reducing Wrench Time by 30%

image_prompt: A high-definition, photo-realistic hero image of a professional industrial storeroom. In the foreground, a clean, organized heavy-duty plastic bin (a "kit") contains a variety of mechanical parts like gears, gaskets, and specialized wrenches, all neatly arranged. In the blurred background, a diverse team of maintenance professionals wearing high-visibility vests and hard hats are collaborating near a large piece of industrial machinery. The lighting is bright and modern, emphasizing a high-tech, efficient manufacturing environment. No text.
